DataElement.preferredName: Patient INRG Stage M Favorable Biologic Features Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response to an eligibility question that asks if the patient has INRG Stage M and favorable biologic features.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient INRG Stage M Favorable Biologic Features Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Neuroblastoma with distant metastatic disease (except MS)._Expressing something as positive, advantageous or desired._Pertaining to biology or to life and living things._A prominent or identifiable aspect, region, or site of interest._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: INRG Stage M Favorable Biological Feature Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Neuroblastoma with distant metastatic disease (except MS).:Expressing something as positive, advantageous or desired.:Pertaining to biology or to life and living things.:A prominent or identifiable aspect, region, or site of interest.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Neuroblastoma with distant metastatic disease (except MS).
Expressing something as positive, advantageous or desired.
Pertaining to biology or to life and living things.
A prominent or identifiable aspect, region, or site of interest.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient greater than or equal to 12 and less than or equal to 18 months of age with INRG Stage M and all 3 favorable biologic features (i.e., non-amplified MYCN, favorable pathology, and DNA index >1)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have INRG Stage
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have INRG Stage M and favorable biologic features?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient between 365-546 days of age with INRG Stage M and MYCN non-amplified NBL, irrespective of additional biologic features?

DataElement.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
